faculty_name: Faculty of Applied Sciences and Technology
note: The Faculty of Applied Sciences and Technology at Ho Technical University offers science, technology, hospitality, agriculture, and ICT programmes from certificate to bachelor level.
Programmes emphasise hands-on laboratory, kitchen, farm, and computer practicals to prepare graduates for Ghana's evolving applied science and service industries.

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 2,800 - 3,400 per semester (estimated 2025/2026; see official fee schedule)
International Students: See HTU 2025/2026 Fee Schedule
mode: Regular, on-campus lectures and practical sessions
Industrial attachment in hotels, restaurants, and resorts
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science/Social Studies plus three (3) relevant elective subjects (Home Economics, General Arts, Business, or Science)
TVET Certificate II: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, Integrated Science plus three (3) relevant trade courses
HND Hotel, Catering and Institutional Management or related field holders may enter at Level 300 (Top-Up)
level_note: Trains students for supervisory and managerial roles across the hospitality industry.
Graduates work in hotels, restaurants, resorts, institutions, and can start their own hospitality ventures.

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 2,800 - 3,400 per semester (estimated 2025/2026)
International Students: See HTU 2025/2026 Fee Schedule
mode: Regular, on-campus lectures and laboratory practicals
Industrial attachment at food processing and regulatory organisations
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics and Integrated Science plus three (3) relevant elective subjects (Chemistry, Biology, Physics, General Agriculture, Elective Mathematics)
TVET Certificate II: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, Integrated Science plus three (3) relevant trade courses in science/food related areas
HND Food Technology holders may enter at Level 300 as Top-Up students
level_note: Provides scientific and technological training for Ghana's food industry.
Graduates support food safety, quality assurance, and product innovation in food companies and regulatory agencies.

courses.course_name: Bachelor of Technology, Tourism, Leisure and Events Management

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 2,700 - 3,300 per semester (estimated 2025/2026)
International Students: See HTU 2025/2026 Fee Schedule
mode: Regular, on-campus with field trips to tourism sites
Industrial attachment in tourism and events organisations
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics and Integrated Science/Social Studies plus three (3) relevant elective subjects (General Arts, Business, Vocational or Science)
TVET Certificate II: Credit passes in English, Mathematics, Integrated Science plus three (3) relevant trade courses
HND Hospitality, Tourism or related holders may enter at Level 300 (Top-Up)
level_note: Prepares graduates to manage tourism destinations, leisure facilities, and events.
Emphasises sustainable tourism, event management, and leisure services.

courses.course_name: Bachelor of Technology, Information and Communication Technology

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 2,800 - 3,400 per semester (estimated 2025/2026)
International Students: See HTU 2025/2026 Fee Schedule
cutt_off: Typical WASSCE aggregate: 24 - 36 (Mathematics and ICT-related electives required)
mode: Regular, on-campus lectures and computer lab practicals
Industrial attachment at ICT firms and institutions
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics and Integrated Science plus three (3) relevant elective subjects (Elective Mathematics, ICT, Physics, Economics, Business)
TVET Certificate II: Credit passes in English, Mathematics, Integrated Science plus three (3) relevant trade/ICT subjects
HND ICT or Computer Science holders may enter at Level 300 (Top-Up)
level_note: Focuses on the design, implementation and management of information systems and networks.
Graduates work in corporate IT departments, telecoms, banks, and public sector ICT units.

courses.course_name: Bachelor of Technology, Agro Enterprise Development

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 2,700 - 3,300 per semester (estimated 2025/2026)
International Students: See HTU 2025/2026 Fee Schedule
mode: Regular, on-campus with farm and field practicals
Industrial attachment in agribusiness firms and NGOs
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics and Integrated Science plus three (3) relevant elective subjects (General Agriculture, Economics, Business, Biology, Elective Mathematics)
TVET Certificate II: Credit passes in English, Mathematics, Integrated Science plus three (3) relevant agricultural trade courses
HND Agro Enterprise Development or General Agriculture holders may enter at Level 300
level_note: Blends agriculture, business, and development to train agribusiness entrepreneurs and managers.
Graduates help commercialise agriculture and develop rural agro-based enterprises.

courses.course_name: Bachelor of Technology, Statistics and Finance
career: Statistics and Finance Lecturer (with further study)

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 2,800 - 3,400 per semester (estimated 2025/2026)
International Students: See HTU 2025/2026 Fee Schedule
cutt_off: Typical WASSCE aggregate: 24 or better (Elective Mathematics required)
mode: Regular, on-campus lectures and computer lab sessions
Industrial attachment in banks, insurance and research institutions
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics and Integrated Science plus three (3) relevant elective subjects (Elective Mathematics compulsory; Physics, Economics, Accounting, Business Management, Geography, or Further Maths)
TVET/GBCE: Equivalent passes including strong mathematics background
HND Statistics or related diploma holders may enter at Level 300
level_note: Interdisciplinary programme combining applied statistics with finance.
Graduates are employed in banking, insurance, pensions, telecoms, and research agencies.

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 2,800 - 3,500 per semester (estimated 2025/2026)
International Students: See HTU 2025/2026 Fee Schedule
cutt_off: Typical WASSCE aggregate: 24 or better (strong maths and science background required)
mode: Regular, on-campus lectures and intensive computer lab work
Industrial attachment with software and technology firms
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics and Integrated Science plus three (3) relevant elective subjects (Elective Mathematics, Physics, ICT, Further Math)
TVET Certificate II/Technician Part II: Relevant computing/electrical options with required passes
HND Computer Science or ICT holders with at least Second Class Lower may enter at Level 300
level_note: Flagship computing degree providing a solid foundation in software and systems development.
Graduates work across banking, telecoms, fintech, government, and global software companies.

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 1,800 - 2,200 per semester (HND Regular; see HTU fee schedule)
International Students: See HTU Fee Schedule
cutt_off: WASSCE aggregate: 36 or better (science background preferred)
mode: Regular weekday lectures and lab practicals
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE: Passes (A1-D7/A-D) in English Language, Mathematics and Integrated Science plus three (3) relevant electives (Biology, Chemistry, Physics, General Agriculture, Food and Nutrition)
GBCE/TVET: Equivalent science-related passes
Mature applicants (25+): relevant work experience and successful entrance examination
level_note: Provides foundational skills for food science and processing roles.
Graduates may progress to BTech Food Technology as top-up students.

courses.course_name: HND Hotel, Catering and Institutional Management

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 1,800 - 2,200 per semester (HND Regular)
International Students: See HTU Fee Schedule
mode: Regular weekday lectures and practical sessions
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE: Passes in English Language, Mathematics, Integrated Science/Social Studies plus three (3) relevant electives (Home Economics, Business, General Arts, Science)
TVET/GBCE: Equivalent hospitality-related passes
Mature applicants: 25+ years with experience in hospitality/catering and successful entrance exam
level_note: Trains supervisors and middle-level staff for hotels, restaurants, and institutions.
Graduates eligible for BTech Hospitality Management/Tourism top-up.

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 2,600 - 3,000 per semester (HND Weekend)
International Students: See HTU Fee Schedule
cutt_off: Same academic cut-off as Regular HND
mode: Weekend lectures and practicals for working students
entry_requirements: Same as Regular HND HCIM, targeted at workers needing weekend study mode
level_note: Weekend option tailored for working professionals in hospitality and catering.
Delivery is concentrated on Fridays, weekends, and vacation periods.

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 1,800 - 2,200 per semester (HND Regular)
International Students: See HTU Fee Schedule
cutt_off: WASSCE aggregate: 36 or better (Elective Mathematics preferred)
mode: Regular lectures and computer lab sessions
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE: Passes in English Language, Mathematics and Integrated Science/Social Studies plus three (3) relevant elective subjects (Elective Mathematics, Accounting, Economics, Business Management, Physics)
GBCE/TVET: Equivalent business/maths-related passes
Mature applicants: 25+ with relevant experience and entrance exam
level_note: Provides foundational quantitative skills for data-related roles.
Graduates can progress to BTech Statistics and Finance or BSc Applied Mathematics.

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 1,800 - 2,200 per semester (HND Regular)
International Students: See HTU Fee Schedule
cutt_off: WASSCE aggregate: 36 or better (Agric background preferred)
mode: Regular lectures, farm and field practicals
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE: Passes in English Language, Mathematics and Integrated Science/Social Studies plus three (3) relevant electives (General Agriculture, Economics, Biology, Animal Husbandry, Crop Husbandry)
TVET: Certificate II agricultural trades plus required cores
Mature applicants: 25+ with experience in agriculture and successful entrance exam
level_note: Builds foundational skills in agribusiness and rural enterprise development.
Graduates can top up to BTech Agro Enterprise Development.

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 1,800 - 2,200 per semester (HND Regular)
International Students: See HTU Fee Schedule
cutt_off: WASSCE aggregate: 36 or better (maths/computing electives recommended)
mode: Regular on-campus lectures and lab sessions
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE: Passes in English Language, Mathematics and Integrated Science/Social Studies plus three (3) relevant electives (Elective Mathematics, ICT, Physics, Economics)
TVET: Certificate II in ICT/computing trades plus required cores
Mature applicants: 25+ with ICT experience and entrance exam
level_note: Provides core computing skills for junior IT roles.
Graduates can progress to BTech Computer Science or ICT top-up.

career: ICT Sales and Customer Support Officer

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 1,800 - 2,200 per semester (HND Regular)
International Students: See HTU Fee Schedule
mode: Regular weekday lectures and lab practicals
entry_requirements: Similar to HND Computer Science: WASSCE/SSSCE passes in core subjects and three relevant electives including ICT/Maths
TVET Certificate II in ICT-related trade plus required cores
Mature applicants: 25+ with ICT experience and entrance exam
level_note: Focuses on applied ICT support skills for organisations.
Graduates often serve as ICT officers and support technicians in schools and offices.

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 2,600 - 3,000 per semester (HND Weekend)
International Students: See HTU Fee Schedule
cutt_off: Same academic cut-off as Regular HND ICT
mode: Weekend and evening lectures for working students
entry_requirements: Same as Regular HND ICT; targeted at working professionals
Applicants often come from IT support and telecoms roles
level_note: Weekend format allows workers to upskill without leaving employment.
Delivery is block-based with intensive weekend sessions.
